results.title: Australian made
results.creator_credit: Richard Lowenstein, John McLean, Tom Hegarty Productions and Captured Live Productions
results.brief_description: Australian music came of age in the summer of 1987 when the cream of Oz rock swept the continent for the most ambitious series of open air concerts ever staged beneath the Southern Cross. Almost 140,000 fans in six cities were entertained with a diverse array of potent and imaginative rock - from understated avant-garde to tempestuous thunder from Down Under. The dynamic performances and behind-the-scenes activity of the tour has generated an exciting, fast paced and imaginative feature film. Includes performances by: INXS ; Jimmy Barnes ; The Triffids ; I’m Talking ; The Saints ; The Divinyls and The Models.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Richard Lowenstein, John McLean, Tom Hegarty Productions and Captured Live Productions

results.title: How to make an American quilt
results.creator_credit: Jocelyn Moorhouse, Midge Sanford, Sarah Pillsbury and Amblin Entertainment
results.brief_description: Winona Ryder shines in this deeply moving and touchingly funny story of a Berkeley graduate student Finn (Ryder) who spends the summer at the home of her sparring Grandmother (Anne Bancroft) and great aunt (Ellyn Burstyn). Their house is a quiet haven where she intends to finish her latest thesis and think over a marriage proposal. This beautifully filmed tale brings unbridled passion, true love, betrayal, joy and heartbreak vividly to life in a captivating cinematic tapestry that celebrates finding your way and following your heart. Based on the novel by Whitney Otto.

results.title: Say a little prayer
results.creator_credit: Richard Lowenstein, Carol Hughes and Flying Films
results.brief_description: Richard Lowenstein’s film “Say a Little Prayer” is an under-rated Australian children’s film about a child’s perspective on the world which adults can enjoy. Eleven year old Seymour is bored during the school holidays, living with his fussy guardian in Richmond. His world changes when he meets the fabulous Angie, a young woman who treats him with respect and loving attention. They begin a friendship which is initially fun until Seymour comes to understand that his friend is a heroin user, and her life not as carefree and safe as he initially believed. Lowenstein’s gift for understanding the specificicities of subculture make this a moving film about families and contemporary dislocation. Sudi de Winter is excellent as Angie and Mickey Camilleri is the shy child Seymour. Co-stars Ben Mendelsohn. Based on Robin Klein’s novel “Came back to show you I could fly” with music by Not Drowning, Waving.

results.title: Evil angels
results.brief_description: No body. No motive. No weapon. The facts in the Australian murder trial of Lindy and Michael Chamberlain didn’t add up. But strangely, other things did. Things like bigotry against the couple’s religion. Scattershot forensic evidence was accepted as fact. And a nationwide hysteria that was the 1980s equivalent of the Salem witchhunt. Much of “Evil Angels” has the bizarre ring of the tabloid headlines. The wholesale abandonment of reason and justice seems too preposterous to be possible in a free and modern country. Believe it. It’s documented in John Bryson’s book “Evil Angels”. Stars Meryl Streep and Sam Neill.

results.title: Strikebound
results.creator_credit: Richard Lowenstein, Timothy White, Miranda Bain and TRM Productions
results.brief_description: In the tiny Victorian town of Korumburra in the 1930’s two Scottish immigrants, Wattie and Agnes Doig, led the first ever stay-in strike in the nation’s history. It was a strike that gave hope and dignity to the life of the coal miner and brought new strengths and inspiration to the working men and women of Australia. This is a reconstruction of that historical event with the dramatisation placed between two excerpts from interviews with Wattie and Agnes Doig. Cast includes Chris Haywood, Carol Burns, Hugh Keays-Byrne.

results.title: The Curse
results.creator_credit: Fyzal Boulifa, Karim Debbagh, Gavin Humphries, Quark Films, British Film Institute and Film4
results.brief_description: Fatine has ventured far from the village to meet her older lover. When she is caught by a small boy, all she wants to do is go home.

results.title: Here to Fall
results.creator_credit: Kris Kelly, Evelyn McGrath, Blacknorth, Arts Council (Ireland) and Irish Film Board
results.brief_description: A girl falls through darkness. A signal is broadcast, it’s a call. City wires connect and vibrate. The digital signal holds her, dropping her to a city’s rooftops that builds around her. She recognises it, and she’s safe, but for how long?
results.creator_credit_for_label: Kris Kelly, Evelyn McGrath, Blacknorth, Arts Council (Ireland) and Irish Film Board

results.title: The Voorman Problem
results.creator_credit: Mark Gill, Baldwin Li, Alastair Connolly and Honlodge
results.brief_description: Doctor Williams, a psychiatrist, is called to a prison to examine Voorman – an inmate with a peculiar affliction – he believes he is a god. The problem is, though, that he’s managed to convince the rest of the prison population that he is indeed telling the truth.
